With 700 hours in the game I can confidently say I know it. A little. Maybe a bit more. It can be hard and frustrating at times, but it can be equally worth it for those mind-blowing plays. Sometimes you'll even make some friends among the community -- I'd say give it a try.

After over 250 hours of this game I feel like I can reasonably say it's worth a buy. It's not the best when it comes to balance or netcode but it somehow keeps you coming back for more. The game is certainly slanted in the favor of killers as I write this but that's shifted over time and I expect it to shift again with the future. As with any multiplayer pvp game balance is always going to be a complaint people have but it's more important to look at the fact that this game genuinely gives a sense of pride when you do well, at least in my opinion. The fact that the tutorial gives you blood points for completing it is honestly something most games should do more. A reason to do the tutorial is often needed for people playing games today. We all assume we can figure it out with some trial and error but sometimes that trial and error makes the game less fun. And instead of forcing a tutorial, make it a bonus that has a genuinely useful reward to get you started. Granted it doesn't teach you everything, but it's enough to get you started. And there are the notes to help you learn what all the little symbols and effects mean. At the end of the day this is just a solid game to play with friends, killer and survivor both have their moments of feeling super fun and super frustrating but that's just the nature of online gaming and asymmetric gameplay. Definitely worth buying, especially if it's on sale which it goes on regularly.

This is the best game ever made, about 10 times better than destiny 2 could ever hope to be. In fact, anyone who even plays destiny 2 is a braindead scumfuck pile of bastard that should be gunned down in the crucible like the dog he is.

The game is almost always fun, especially if you don't take the competitive aspect of the game all that serious, all the time. I recommend this game, especially to play with friends in survivor mode. If playing survivor is not your thing, and you want to play as killer, that also can be a lot of fun. Just try to remember to have fun, and not take the comp aspect of the game all that serious all the time. It can get frustrating

Let me start by saying that I am not a fan of horror. I don't know why YouTube had a game play video in my feed, but after watching OhmWrecker play a few matches, it piqued my interest. Now I am hooked. The thrill, adrenaline, and the chase just keeps me coming back. 

It can be aggravating at times, but that makes the wins that much more satisfying.

For new comers, play with Claudette. Her nickname isn't Blendette for no reason.

I have almost 400 hours in this game, I would be lying if I said it wasn't occasionally enjoyable. When I bought this game I had a blast. It was buggy and needed work but it was such a good concept and there truly is no other game like it. The longer I played however, the worse it got. Despite this I am very much addicted to it. If you like rage inducing games, you have found a good one.

As a survivor: if the game lags and you get hit because of it, you are the problem. If you lag and survive because of it, you're a hacker. If you do anything that allows you to not be immediately downed and killed, you are a toxic piece of shit and you should die. This includes (but not limited to): Healing, running away, pallet stunning, flashlight blinding, running out the gate, getting the hatch, having any item what so ever, running any kind of perk that could give you any advantage at all. If you leave to save yourself, you get reported. If you go back to save another teammate you are most likely going to die, and get reported.

As a killer: getting 4 kills in one match is either impossible because they ranked the lowest rank killer with the highest rank survivors, or it is super easy because of the reverse. If you kill any survivor, you're sweaty. If you farm, you're trash. If you use perks at all, survivors will jump down your throat, if you use no perks, doubly so.

Even though I see both sides, the game is entirely killer sided. They say they want a survivor perk struck down, it gets struck down. They want a new killer? They get a new killer with extremely OP powers. Survivors get an occasional perk upgrade only to have things like instant med-kits take 8 seconds, completely ruining instant med-kits. 

I lose more matches than I win, and that's fair. I tend to slide right into the killer's arms by accident damn near ever match. But I see killers hit pro players from across the map. I have seen killers walk faster than survivors run with perks. It is completely ridiculous and frankly I just can't do it anymore, because I could deal with all that if I didn't get messages like "Kill urself" after EVERY SINGLE MATCH no matter if I win or lose.

The devs 100% don't listen to survivor mains, only killer mains. There is so many problems with this game on all sides. Survivors and killers all agree the game is severely unbalanced, we just disagree on how.

First thought that came to my mind when writing this review: Extremely fun OR extremely toxic. 
It depends on how good you are at the game AND the people you are in the lobby with.

Honestly, from the hours I have played until now, I have spent about 200 hours on Survivor only. The reason behind this was because I was horrified by the idea of playing Killer for the first time. The survivors can be toxic and gang up on you, which can make a game for a Killer less enjoyable (I have experienced this too many times).

Now that I have grown past that fear, I have started practicing the Killers. They are much more fun (in my opinion) IF you get the hang of it. 

However, at Rank 15 you will already start to encounter Survivors that have 1.000+ hours on just this game. Still, everytime I play as a Killer, I just hope the Survivors play this game normally and not buttdance everytime they drop a pallet.
I get matched with players who are clearly better than me (players that have 6 ranks higher than me with a full squad, for example) and this just ruins the experience for the Killers, since it will always be a 1v4.

But when I have fun... boy, do I have fun. 

Despite this, I have spent a lot of hours on this game and I really think these hours have not gone to waste. I will probably keep playing Dead By Daylight for a long time... but probably not as a Killer.

Ну а еще кто любит сюжеты от которых дух захватывает и полностью продуманные задания то вам сюда, почини генератор 12 раз пока маньяк будет вешать тебя на крюк, сломай 95 палет пока входишь в игру, создай тотемы для маньяка что бы он вас переиграл и уничтожил.
Ну а разработчикам надо намекнуть что уже пришла пора для маньяка который пьет бензин из генераторов и они становятся не доступны, после этого он 1 минуту может телепортироваться к любым сурвам без КД.

So I have been playing for quite some time, although I didn't rack up as many hours, I started playing about when Nurse was added, the game was way better, with ping and all, but now it just feels both pay to win and not that exciting anymore, always looking for ways to piss off the killer, the killer camping so on and so forth, the real issues are the servers, they were supposed to fix things, not make killers wait 15 minutes for a game only for a survivor to dc if they see a very rare offering just to piss off the killer, overall, this game is not worth it anymore, shame, it used to be amazing, THE ONLY justification for buying it is playing with 4 other friends where 1 is the killer and 4 survive, that's hilarious, but that would be the only reason possible(Do also buy it on a sale, full asking price is not worth it)

This is one of my favorite games, but it is absolutely not something I would recommend. 
-The new player experience is terrible; you get matched against higher ranked players with more perks and hundreds, even thousands of more hours than you before you get out of this game's equivalent Bronze. Only after you climb out of the beginner ranks do you get matched against people you belong with. Why the devs chose to do this, I absolutely do not know.
-The Teachable Perks system is starting to get out of hand. As the devs release more and more Killers, Dead by Daylight is starting to become more and more pay-to-win. The best perks for both sides (Decisive Strike / Barbecue and Chili) are for licensed characters, which can only be bought with real money. Most of the other decent perks need to be earned from characters you can grind for playtime, but that's still a solid investment of at least 30+ hours (Spirit Fury / Infectious Fright / Monitor and Abuse for instance). Something needs to be done about Teachable Perks.
-This game has easily the single most toxic community in any game I have ever played. League of Legends? Overwatch? CS:GO? Apex? None of these games have a dime on the toxicity and salt this game bleeds. Imagine getting flamed for buying Control Wards in LoL, being revived by a Mercy in OW, or using Wraith's phase to dodge in Apex. That's the kind of convoluted bullshit mindgames Killers and Survivors will pull on you. 

This game is amazing. I have at least 1.5k hours on console, and my PC hours are up at the top. I've played Dead by Daylight consistently for years, support the devs through (most of) their decisions, buy almost every chapter, and I'm going to buy the new Rift Pass as well. But if you're not absolutely sure that this is the game for you, [i] do not buy it. [/i]

I, like most people, have a love and hate relationship with DBD. The game is glitchy, the hit boxes unfair, and overall just not very well balanced. But it can be so fun. I only play with friends and love trying to survive with my besties or doing a kill your friends match and scaring them! I think the devs should realize that, while they want this to be a game people play alone to be scared, that isn't what the majority of their fan base wants anymore. I love that the only pay aspect of this game is cosmetic (I did pay for the current pass and I love all the lil cosmetics I get! It's easy to rank it up and I suck.) I really hate the ranking system as well as the match making system, but I won't stop playing. Overall, 7/10!
